subject: Climate & Environment
title: Megafauna Collapse
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Megafauna Collapse.

hook.text: Woolly mammoths, giant sloths, and saber-toothed cats all vanished within a few thousand years.

buildup.text: Between 50,000 and 10,000 years ago, nearly all large land animals outside Africa disappeared.

discovery.text: Wherever humans arrived â€” Australia, the Americas, islands â€” megafauna vanished shortly after.

twist.text: Climate change played a role, but the timing matches human arrival too closely to ignore.

climax.text: Africa kept its megafauna because animals there evolved alongside humans over millions of years.

punchline.text: Animals that never met humans didn't survive the introduction.

quiz.question: Why did Africa retain more megafauna than other continents?
options: Animals co-evolved with humans over millions of years
African animals were larger and stronger
